chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor
Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlando Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 
lf probation will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due. lf the defendant's probation is revoked with outstanding financial obligations and a jail sentence is ordered at the sentencing after revocation, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall have no contact with BBG or BBG's residence.  
Defendant shall have no contact with Officer ES except for incidental contact.

supervisions.notes: Commencing forthwith.  Time shall be served with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  Transfer is authorized to a jail convenient to defendant's employment and or residence.
Balance of $250 DNA surcharge and $268 felony court costs previously ordered to be paid within 120 days or judgment shall be entered.

Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Orlando Hernandez in custody and by Attorney Edgar Beltran.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Orlando Hernandez in court in custody and by Attorney Matthew Edward Weil.  Resolution reached.  State is in compliance with victim rights.  Upon a plea to Ct. 1, State moves to dismiss and read in Cts. 2, 3 and 4.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1.  Court finds defendant guilty on Ct. 1 and orders Cts. 2, 3 and 4 dismissed and read in.  Argument by counsel.  Statement by defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Orlando Hernandez in court in custody and by Attorney Matthew Edward Weil.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.

Prosecuting Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Atty. Matthew Weil.  Counsel's first appearance.  Atty. Weil motions for modification of bail.  State opposes.  Argument by counsel.  Court denies any bond modification.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with BBG or his residence. No contact with Officer Strunsee, except incidental

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Orlando Hernandez in court, in custody.  Attorney Wilfred P. de Junco in court for Orlando Hernandez. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. State requests $5,000.00 cash bond.  Atty. de Junco requests signature bond.  Court orders $1,000.00 cash bond.  Defendant eligible for State Public Defender. Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
